text: in my country and most of the world as I
know it the work week starts on Monday
morning and the weekend starts on Friday
evening in the Muslim world the work
week starts on Sunday morning and the
weekend begins on Thursday evening due
to important Friday prayers but here in
Iran the work week starts on Saturday
morning yet still ends on Thursday
evening making the weekend here one day
shorter than everyone else's I didn't
realize this until I was walking around
Tehran this Saturday morning and noticed
everything being so busy
the streets are mobbed with traffic
businesses are all open except for
restaurants since it's Ramadan bazaars
are in full force and the atmosphere is
just electric I really have to keep
reminding myself that today is Saturday
and not Monday this is just one of those
travel things that you would never
realize until you experience it for
yourself
and although I just arrived in this
lovely country I'm already having dozens
of visualizations like snowy mountaintop
in May I'm truly loving this place so
just remember while you're next Saturday
may be spent like this in Iran it's
exactly the opposite I'm drew pinsky and
if you like my travel videos please
click Subscribe and join me as I plan to
visit every country in the world
